page.title: 07THE PONTESBURY SURGERY.
page.content: The Pontesbury Doctors' practice is in the middle of the village and has been there for eight years. There are three partners, two female doctors, and one assistant. There are also two nurses. It is a general practice and they are interested in obstetrics and minor surgery. The surgery has its own dispensary and 95% of their patients are on the National Health Service.There are around 6000 patients.There are surgeries on six mornings and three evenings each week.There is an ante-natal clinic where patients are seen by the midwife.The practice also has two branch surgeries. Doctors are on call two days a week. The most common ailments are respiratory infections and problems arising from stress.The Doctors would most like to find an answer for mental illness.
